text: Brian "Blunt" Glennie (August 29, 1946 â€“ February 7, 2020) was a Canadian professional ice hockey defenceman. He was born in Toronto. Glennie played in the NHL from 1969 until 1979. Glennie was a master of the hip-check. He played for Toronto Maple Leafs, Los Angeles Kings, Rochester Americans, and Tulsa Oilers. Glennie won a bronze medal at the 1968 Winter Olympics. Glennie died on February 7, 2020 at the age of 73.Longtime Toronto Maple Leafs D Glennie dead at 73 ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Toronto Maple Leafs players Category:Los Angeles Kings players Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Canada Category:Ice hockey people from Toronto Category:Ice hockey defencemen
title: Brian Glennie
